result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:37 PM Defendant Andrea L Trapino in court.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court and parties discuss status and waiver of attorney previously filed. Defendant to go to SPD today to apply and if rejected to complete CDP paperwork.
ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in person and signed Waiver of Right to Attorney. Plea/sentencing scheduled, NIH.
Plea hearing on September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

09:59 AM Defendant appeared.  Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
